text: Huang Qixiang (; 2 September 1898 – 10 December 1970) was a Chinese military commander and statesman. He led the Chinese Action Committee for National Liberation in 1933 during the short-lived People's Revolutionary Government of the Republic of China. Huang was a recipient of the Order of Blue Sky and White Sun. ==References== *北伐名将、抗日功臣黄琪翔 - 社会活动家、画家郭秀仪 Category:National Revolutionary Army generals from Guangdong Category:Hakka generals Category:People from Meixian District Category:1898 births Category:1970 deaths Category:People's Republic of China politicians from Guangdong Category:Victims of the Cultural Revolution Category:Recipients of the Order of Blue Sky and White Sun Category:Politicians from Meizhou Category:Chinese Peasants' and Workers' Democratic Party politicians Category:Victims of the Anti-Rightist Campaign
title: Huang Qixiang
